elements.title: Antoinette Tidjani Alou (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Antoinette Tidjani Alou (pictured) wrote a work of autofiction that traces the journey of a Jamaican woman who moved to Niger for love?

elements.title: Zhenjiu dacheng (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1601 medical text Zhenjiu dacheng recommends acupuncture-based cures for mental illness?

elements.title: Park Ji-hyun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Park Ji-hyun helped to expose an online sex-crime ring and later became the interim co-chair of the Democratic Party of Korea at the age of 26?

elements.title: Aesculapian Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Aesculapian Club, founded in Edinburgh in 1773, still meets twice a year?

elements.title: Glock switch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Glock switch is a device that can turn a handgun into a machine gun?

elements.title: Liz Shore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Liz Shore's nomination to be Chief Medical Officer of the United Kingdom was vetoed by Margaret Thatcher because of Shore's husband's political affiliation?

elements.title: Allegheny river cruiser (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Allegheny river cruiser can be accurately identified by holding it or by studying its genitalia?

elements.title: T. J. Carter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Los Angeles Rams roster features T. J. Carter and T. J. Carter?
